com.github.s3curitybug.similarityuniformfuzzyhash

Class ToStringUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.s3curitybug.similarityuniformfuzzyhash.ToStringUtils

  • public final class ToStringUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides utility methods and constants to build string representations of Uniform Fuzzy Hashes.
    Author:
    s3curitybug@gmail.com

      • prepareIdentifier

        public static <T> java.lang.String prepareIdentifier(T identifier,
                                                     int truncateLength)
        Converts an identifier to string and prepares it to be printed.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Identifier type.
        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier.
        truncateLength - Maximum length of the returned string. If this parameter is lower than 1, no truncation is performed.
        Returns:
        The identifier prepared to be printed.

      • prepareIdentifiers

        public static <T> java.util.List<java.lang.String> prepareIdentifiers(java.util.Collection<T> identifiers,
                                                                      int truncateLength)
        Prepares a collection of identifiers to be printed.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Identifiers type.
        Parameters:
        identifiers - The collection of identifiers.
        truncateLength - Maximum length of the returned string. If this parameter is lower than 1, no truncation is performed.
        Returns:
        The list of identifiers prepared to be printed.

      • formatDecimal

        Formats a decimal number.
        Parameters:
        decimal - A decimal number.
        Returns:
        The formatted decimal number.

      • formatDecimal

        public static java.lang.String formatDecimal(java.lang.Double decimal,
                                             double markAbove,
                                             double markBelow)
        Formats a decimal number, marking it with a color if it is above or equal to a threshold, and with another color if it is below another threshold.
        Parameters:
        decimal - A decimal number.
        markAbove - Mark the decimal with a color if it is above or equal to this threshold. Introduce a negative number to not mark the decimal.
        markBelow - Mark the decimal with a color if it is below this threshold. Introduce a negative number to not mark the decimal.
        Returns:
        The formatted and possibly marked decimal number.

      • repeatString

        public static java.lang.String repeatString(java.lang.String string,
                                            int n)
        Parameters:
        string - A string to be repeated.
        n - Amount of repetitions.
        Returns:
        A string formed by the repetition of the introduced string n times.

        Returns:
